Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Projects targetting net5.0-windows, end up generating a condition with an incorrect TargetFramework string" (#9914) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This is a consequence of https://github.com/nuget/home/issues/9756. 

Some initial work started in `dev-nkolev92-originalTargetFrameworkCondition`

I'd estimate a 5-10 point task for someone familiar with the problem space.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Update the VS/MSBuild dependencies throughout our repo" (#9950) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
It's good practice to keep our VS/MSBuild dependencies up to date. 
This tasks covers moving from prerelease to stable versions for MSBUild and bringing the VS dependencies as close to current shipping as possible.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Update the SPDX license list" (#9946) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: The spdx license list is not up to date and needs updated with the latest version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
